Mastercard, a US-based innovator and global technology company in the payments industry, has signed an agreement to invest USD100 million in Airtel Mobile Commerce BV, a wholly owned subsidiary of Airtel Africa plc. As a part of transaction, Mastercard will hold a minority stake in AMC BV upon completion of the transaction, with Airtel Africa continuing to hold the majority stake. Alongside the investment, the Group and Mastercard have extended commercial agreements and signed a new commercial framework which will deepen their partnerships across numerous geographies and areas. The transaction is subject to customary closing conditions including necessary regulatory filings and approvals, and the transfer of specified mobile money business assets and contracts into AMC BV.

Airtel Mobile Commerce intends to use the proceeds to reduce Group debt and invest in network and sales infrastructure in the respective operating countries.
